FacilityName: ProGas Company, Inc. - Office and Bottle Plant
FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
CERTIFICATION STATEMENT

To the best of Independent Propane Company's knowledge, information, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.

Date: October 1, 2002

RMP Prepared by ECS Risk Control

Verified by: Chris Alt, Director Risk and Safety, Independent Propane Company

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

It is the policy of Independent Propane Company to adhere to all applicable federal, state , and local laws.  This facility complies with EPA's Accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The Anhydrous Ammonia System is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with applicable state and federal laws.  This facility is inspected regularly by the fire Marshal.

This facility is a bulk storage and retail propane facility.  There is a 12,000 gallon aboveground storage tank for anhydrous ammonia.

Worst Case Scenario Toxics): Tank failure of the 12,000 gallon aboveground storage tank, resulting in the liquid spill and vaporiztion of approximately 52,530 pounds of anhydrous ammonia.  According to the EPA's look-up tables, the distance to the endpoint is calculated as 3.80 miles.  Depending on wind direction, this endpoint may include most of the city of Waynesboro.  Waynesboro has an estimated total population if 5,825.

There has never been an accident at this facility involving anhydrous ammonia that resulted in deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.  There are no planned changes to the safety procedures for this facility.

In the event of an emergency involving anhydrous ammonia, it is our policy to notify the Waynesboro Fire Department and the Burke County Emergency Management Agency for emergency response assistance.
